oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Automated identification of protein structural features
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MAMIDIPALLY, C
NORONHA, SB
ROY, SD
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: alignment
algorithm
patterns
fold
protein motifs
robust features
protein structure comparison
clustering
active sites
biologically significant substructures
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper proposes an iterative clustering procedure for finding protein motifs which do not necessarily correspond to secondary structures, or to features along the protein backbone. We show the applicability of our method to two important applications namely, protein structure matching, and automatically identifying active sites and other biologically significant sub-structures in proteins.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: PATTERN RECOGNITION AND MACHINE INTELLIGENCE, PROCEEDINGS,5909,171-176
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 3rd International Conference on Pattern Recognition and Machine Intelligence,New Delhi, INDIA,DEC 16-20, 2009
